photo.description: Shanghai China, from the Jin Mao Tower. Starting at the left: Pudong Shangri La Hotel Extension (浦东香格里拉大酒店) Built 2002-2005, Height 180m (591 ft), Floors 43. Shanghai IFC South Tower (上海国际金融中心2号楼) Built 2006-2009, Height 250m (820 ft), Floors 60ish. Oriental Pearl Tower (东方明珠电视塔) Built 1990-94, Height - Antenna 468m (1,535 ft) Height - Roof 350m (1,148 ft) Floors 14. Bank of China Tower (上海中银大厦) Built 1999, Height 226.1m (741.7 ft), Floors 57. Edge of frame: Bocom Financial Towers (交银金融大厦) Built 1997 - 2002, Height - Spire 265m (869 ft), Height - North Roof 230m (754.5 ft), Height - South Roof 197.4m (647.6 ft), Floors 52.

photo.title: Jin Mao Tower & view, Shanghai

photo.description: The five-star, 555-room Shanghai Grand Hyatt hotel which occupies floors 53 to 87 of the Jin Mao Tower. It is one of the highest hotels in the world, second only to its sister property, the Shanghai Park Hyatt, occupying the 79th to 93rd floors of the immediately adjacent Shanghai World Financial Center. This barrel-vaulted atrium starts at the 56th floor and extends upwards to the 87th (the image is taken on the 88th floor looking downward to the 56th!). Lined with 28 annular corridors and staircases arrayed in a spiral, it is 27m (75.5ft) in diameter with a clear height of approximately 115m (377ft). It is one of the tallest atriums in the world.

photo.title: Jin Mao Tower

photo.description: Jin Mao Tower with Shanghai World Financial Center being built on the right. Shanghai, China
photo.title: The birth of a giant

photo.description: The Jin Mao Building or Jin Mao Tower (Chinese: 金茂大厦; pinyin: Jīn Mào Dàshà; literally "Golden Prosperity Building") is an 88-story landmark skyscraper in the Lujiazui area of the Pudong district of Shanghai, People's Republic of China. It contains offices and the Shanghai Grand Hyatt hotel. As of 2005, it is the tallest building in the PRC, the fifth tallest in the world by roof height and the seventh tallest by pinnacle height. Along with the Oriental Pearl Tower, it is a centerpiece of the renowned Pudong skyline. It may be surpassed in 2008 by the Shanghai World Financial Center. [Wikipedia]
photo.title: Over the cover of darkness

photo.description: View from Jin Mao Tower. Pearl Tower on the right. Huangpu right behind. Shanghai, People's Republic of China.

It contains offices and the Shanghai Grand Hyatt hotel. As of 2005, it is the tallest building in the PRC, the fifth tallest in the world by roof height and the seventh tallest by pinnacle height. Along with the Oriental Pearl Tower, it is a centerpiece of the renowned Pudong skyline. It may be surpassed in 2008 by the Shanghai World Financial Center. [Wikipedia]

photo.title: filaments

photo.description: Skyline, Shanghai China. From left to right: 21st Century Mansion Built 2007-2009, Height 210m (689 ft), Floors 50. Shanghai World Financial Center (上海环球金融中心) Built 1997-2008, Height 492m (1,614 ft), Floors 101. The long construction on this building is due to a fund shortage caused by the Asian financial crisis, this halted the project after the foundations were completed. Jin Mao Tower (金茂大厦) Built 1994-1998, Height spire 420.5m (1,379 ft), Height 366m (1,200 ft), Floors 93. Perspective correction via Hugin.

photo.description: The Jin Mao Building or Jin Mao Tower (Chinese: 金茂大厦; pinyin: Jīn Mào Dàshà; literally "Golden Prosperity Building") is an 88-story landmark skyscraper in the Lujiazui area of the Pudong district of Shanghai, People's Republic of China. It contains offices and the Shanghai Grand Hyatt hotel. As of 2005, it is the tallest building in the PRC, the fifth tallest in the world by roof height and the seventh tallest by pinnacle height. Along with the Oriental Pearl Tower, it is a centerpiece of the renowned Pudong skyline. It may be surpassed in 2008 by the Shanghai World Financial Center. [Wikipedia]

photo.title: Jin Mao Tower.

photo.description: The Jin Mao Building or Jin Mao Tower (Chinese: 金茂大厦; pinyin: Jīn Mào Dàshà; literally "Golden Prosperity Building") is an 88-story landmark skyscraper in the Lujiazui area of the Pudong district of Shanghai, People's Republic of China. It contains offices and the Shanghai Grand Hyatt hotel. As of 2005, it is the tallest building in the PRC, the fifth tallest in the world by roof height and the seventh tallest by pinnacle height. Along with the Oriental Pearl Tower, it is a centerpiece of the renowned Pudong skyline. It may be surpassed in 2008 by the Shanghai World Financial Center. [Wikipedia]
photo.tags: travel trip microsoft china shanghai asia geotagged geo:lat=3123788516750211 geo:lon=1215010868112956

photo.description: The Jin Mao Tower in Shanghai is the tallest building in mainland China. On the 58th to the 87th floor is the Grand Hyatt Hotel, the highest hotel in the world. I knelt before its size... so that I might take a picture of it.
photo.tags: 1022mm buildings typebuildings lens1022mm
photo.title: Jin Mao Tower - 上海金茂大厦

photo.description: The Jin Mao Tower (simplified Chinese: 金茂大厦; traditional Chinese: 金茂大廈; pinyin: Jīn Mào Dàshà; literally "Golden Prosperity Building") is an 88-story landmark supertall skyscraper in the Lujiazui area of the Pudong district of Shanghai, People's Republic of China. It contains offices and the Shanghai Grand Hyatt hotel. Until 2007 it was the tallest building in the PRC, the fifth tallest in the world by roof height and the seventh tallest by pinnacle height. Along with the Oriental Pearl Tower, it is a centerpiece of the Pudong skyline. Its height was surpassed on September 14, 2007 by the Shanghai World Financial Center which is next to the building.[2] The Shanghai Tower, a 128-story building located next to these two buildings and now under construction, will be even taller.[3] Read more at wikipedia
photo.tags: canoneos5dmkii canonef1740mmf4l shanghai china
photo.title: Jin Mao Tower, Shanghai 金茂大厦

photo.title: Shang high up in the air

photo.description: View from Jin Mao Tower. This was the only day of my trip with practically no smog. I had visited the observation deck of Jin Mao Tower before, but since the weather was so fine, I came here again. I didn't have a tripod with me, so this is shot by holding the camera against the window and using window frame for additional support. Best viewed large.
photo.tags: shanghai travel asia china night urban cityscape fav shanghaiist
photo.title: Shanghai day 9, City Lights

photo.description: The Shanghai World Financial Center (Abbr: SWFC; simplified Chinese: 上海环球金融中心) is a supertall skyscraper in Pudong, Shanghai, China. It is a mixed use skyscraper which consists of offices, hotels, conference rooms, observation decks, and shopping malls on the ground floors. Park Hyatt Shanghai is the hotel component containing 174 rooms and suites. Occupying the 79th to the 93rd floors, it is the highest hotel in the world, surpassing the Grand Hyatt Shanghai on the 53rd to 87th floors of the neighboring Jin Mao Tower. Read more at Wikipedia
photo.tags: canoneos5dmkii canonef1740mmf4l shanghai china

photo.description: Le Centre mondial des finances de Shanghai est, à sa livraison, le troisième plus haut gratte-ciel du monde avec ses 492 mètres pour 101 étages. Il est surnommé le décapsuleur. Avant lui, le plus haut gratte-ciel de Shanghai était le Jin Mao Tower que l'on voit derrière à sa droite.
